review: This place is great!  Service is generally friendly and quick.  I visit this place often and I'm very happy with it.   The burgers are good but they have a large enough selection of non-burger items that it keeps me coming back.  They have a few really good salads and their chicken sandwiches are good too.  I've never tried their desserts.
Decent food, better than the last red robin i ate at, but they were clearly understaffed tonight.

I eat at Red Robin occasionally before I go to the movies. Usually the experience isn't too bad. The food is consistently tasty and the service is hit or miss. I got on here, however, to applaud our waitress, Sybil, who served us last time. It was extremely busy and when we had been seated, we waited about four minutes before she appeared, extremely apologetic, and explained that tables had gotten switched and nobody had told her. Our drinks promptly appeared and she took our orders. She was very polite and friendly in spite of being very obviously harried, and our service was top notch from that point on. Even though there was a bit of a wait for our food because the kitchen was backed up, we didn't mind because she was so sincere in her friendliness and explaining exactly what was going on. This particular night I wasn't too pleased with my food but I was so pleased by her sweetness I didn't mind. Thank you, Sybil, for making the experience all the better for me. I'll be asking to sit in your section from now on.

I came towards the end of the SuperBowl (so the restaurant was EMPTY!). Our food came out pretty quickly, considering no one was there.  The food was medicore and bland. I had the onion rings, which were good but were obviously sitting out for a while.  The husband had the Chicken Teriyaki, which was ok at best. When he got the sandwich, he asked me - "Do you see the chicken?" If I have a random craving for the best restaurant when I was in High School, I'll come by.
Awesome! I come here all the time! I really like the feel that you get with the adult version and kid version. Try the Mighty Caeser Salad!!! It is so yummy!!!

I just had dinner at Red Robin  tonight with my children. I find it odd that some children would get offered balloons and others (like my son) would not. The waitress was good, she kept checking up on us to see if we are ok. Towards the end of the dinner, I got up from the table and my purse fell out along with its contents. While I was picking up my stuff, my 4 year old son wondered a bit and got close to the man with the small tub bussing the table. To make story short he hit my son on the eye with the side of his tub. He didn't even bother to turn around and apologize, that is just plain rude. My son was really hurt and I was, of course upset. I was trying to look for the bus boy, but he quickly disappeared. On the way out, I told the hostess what had happened and she just looked at me as if she does not care. She just said okay and no apologies. That to me, is just plain rude. I don't think we are going to be dining here in a looooong or until their service improves. Well, probably never. Oh, food is mediocre and the portions are getting smaller by the minute. I made a mistake of coming out here tonight. I should've listened to my daughter and dined at  Islands Restaurant instead.  No wonder this place is always empty. I predict that this location will not remain open for long.

I hadn't been to a Red Robin since when I was back in Seattle, which was a good decade ago.   The food is always tasty and the service is usually pretty good. This visit I was sitting at the bar and probably ordering a Corona a little early (11:30am) but I didn't care, I was thirsty dammit!   Happily, the bartender was responsive to my request and the race was on to quench my thirst! :) After checking into the various social media channels, which I seem to do before even looking at a menu (though not before quenching my thirst), suddenly there is a tip in Foursquare from Sukhraj B. to check out the Chicken Caesar Wrap. I take a look at the menu for the Chicken Caesar Wrap.  Hmmm, it sounds rather tasty.  I'll go for it! :) The bartender comes back over and I tell her I would like to try the Chicken Caesar Wrap.  She quickly looks at my Corona and before she could ask, I requested another. :) So I sat and relaxed for a few, enjoying my Corona and watching ESPN on the little TV which was reporting on the recent New Orleans Bounty aftermath.   Soon, my Chicken Caesar Wrap with bottomless Steak Fries arrived!  The wrap was delicious!  And the steak fries.. well, as usual very tasty!  Granted, I skip any dipping sauce and just enjoy them plain ... with a side of Corona. As I finished my meal and polished off my Corona, the Manager came over to make sure I was happy.  I told him I was very happy and would certainly return. :)

ive been to red robbin for many many times because my brother really loves this place.... he always come here for the bottomless fries and their burgers... the often have a limited time promotion offers and my brother likes to come here to try their new burger...  so for the last time we came here, he ordered their new bacon burger for about $10 ( ). his score for this burger was 7/10... i dont like bacon in general, so i cannot really comment on it. my ordered was lettuce wrap fish burger ( ). i really like their lettuce wrap burger and this is what i normally order whenever i come here. ive tried their salad and some shrimp menu, but i prefer this lettuce wrap burger overall. and you can lettuce wrap any type of burgers you want. its good and healthy too. In case you dont want their bottomless fries, you can always substitute it with other things like coleslaw, melon, broccoli, and some other things. their coleslaw wasnt that great though, it was dry and really tasteless. customer service is really nice.. the lady that served us was really helpful and friendly..  even though im not a big fan of burger, ill definitely come back bcoz of my brother and for their letttuce wrap.

Love this place, its new and very vivid in its design, great interior. I have to say what brought us here is the fact they serve gluten free buns if you ask. my wife is wheat intolerant and loves them. She enjoys the prime chophouse and the staff are always good to come back and point out that items in the burger may contain wheat. I have to say I like the royal red robin burger, its has all the usual but also a fried egg, its great and not greasy.

My husband, daughter, and I were at this location about a month ago for a normal weekday dinner. We always enjoy the food here and especially the endless steak fries, but this particular night, despite the lack of customers, we just couldn't seem to get our food. After what seemed like forever, the manager came over and alerted us to the fact that our waiter had forgotten to put in out food order but it would be out soon. As you can imagine, with a two year old this was a near crisis, because she was pretty hungry. He rushed her order out, brought out some fries and carrot sticks with ranch while we were waiting. Overall we were OK with the wait because he was really accommodating us while we waited. We finally got out meal and it was great as always. The real surprise came when the manager brought the bill and it had been completely taken care of, something we never would have expected despite the wait. The customer service we experienced at this Red Robin was nothing short of exceptional. You must visit this location and I assure you that even if something goes wrong, you will be taken care of immediately and that is the reason we will continue to be customers. Good customer service is SOOOO hard to find these days,  way to go Red Robin!! p.s. best burgers are the Blue Cheese and BBQ Whiskey burgers, and gotta try the strawberry lemonade :-)

Remember the good ol' monster burger?! Order the red robin's burger w/ extra relish & voila!  The mini monster burger is born! (Because it comes w/ 1 patty) Other good things to know, when you order the spaghetti or Mac n' cheese off the kids menu, you can order 1 refill for free and you have your kids meal for the next day!  It does not state this anywhere on the menu.  Our server advised us of this.  Who knew!  All these years and this was the first time anyone had ever said this to us! All the RR joints look the same and the servers are hit and miss but the food never dissapoints!

Went here a week after my birthday so that I could get my free burger. Waiter was very attentive and even wished me a late birthday. The best part, dude brought be out a free sundae. Did I say this was a week after my birthday? Niceeeeeeeee.

My family loves to goto Red Robin. We always ask for the fries and ranch (to dip) when we get our drinks.  I love the blue cheese burger. My daughter loves the corn dog and Hubby likes the original with relish (not on the menu).  The waitstaff is really great at this location!!

5 STARS due to their exceptional customer service.  This really was a surprising experience. We stopped in for lunch on 10/13/12 as we had been shopping nearby.  Was greeted with a friendly & cheerful welcome and our server was at our table promptly after we were seated. All was good - burgers, etc....what the real topping was when I ordered coffee.  Now I don't usually drink coffee in the afternoon but it just sounded good.  Our server said she would be glad to brew a fresh pot. A few minutes later the manager came to our table and apologized for their coffee machine being out of order.  I can deal with that...I said "it's fine, really."  However, the manager then offered to "go across the street to the coffee shop and get me a coffee..."  I looked at her like "where's the joke" but she was serious. She said "we truly value customer service so we go above and beyond."  I was so amazed at this!  I thanked her so much for the very kind offer but really did not need a cup of coffee that bad.  Our overall impressions were - the food is fine, but this place total is top notch for customer service - they really do aim to please. Thank you!

All I can say is, "Go here if you want a strong drink and to keep the kids happy, too." (sans the alcohol, of course!)  This place has something for everyone, just wish it was quieter.  It's as loud as a Chuck E Cheese, so beware!

Came here for dinner before heading off to see a movie at the movie complex near by. For a Friday night, the place wasn't busy which was nice. We knew we wouldn't wait long for our food :)   We go inside and are then seated to our table.  As we were making our way to the table, my friend asked if we could sit somewhere else (away from the area where everyone will be walking by) and the Host said "sure".  And he showed us to another table with no problems.  Our waitress, Leticia came over and welcomed us back to Red Robin.  She took our drink orders. I ordered a lemonade and my friend ordered an ice tea.  I just have to say that I love their lemonade. She brings our drinks and takes our order.  I get the Gourmet Cheeseburger plain, well done. My friend ordered the same but with everything on it and medium well. He also asked that his fries be well done too ... where they are crispy. Shortly after, Leticia brings our food.  She places mine down in front of me and it looks delicious as always.  As she places my friends basket down, she tells him that the fries will be out in a couple of minutes.  She just wants to make sure they come out the way he wants them.  A couple minutes later, she brings out a basket of fries and asks if they are crispy enough for him.  By the looks of it, I would have thought yes, but for him, they weren't.  She smiled and said "no problem" and she went back to the kitchen and ask for another basket but for them to be a little more crispy.  A couple minutes later, she comes back out and they are crispy enough for my friend.   Leticia also mentioned that she has another basket of crispy fries just in case he wanted more.  I was impressed with her attitude about the crispy fries.  One would think they would sigh or roll their eyes or give some sort of bothered attitude, but not for Leticia.  She was happy to make sure that we had our food the way we wanted it.  Service here on this particular night was excellent! :)
the service was ok, and the food was awful, this is the second time i have gone here and both times the service and food was awful, i wont be returning to this place save your money and time.

Our whole service department went to lunch here.  We were supposed to meet at Islands Burger,  but we changed our minds after getting an attitude from the Islands' restaurant manager.  So we ended up go across the street to this place. So we ordered appetizers to share, the best of all is the onion rings. The waiter whose serviced our table handled everything very well--bravo on that. But when it came to real order, I had the bleu ribbon burger, which very bland to my taste, but on the menu they state it's "award winning."  WHAT??? They must be kidding or they should put the judges in jail. :-)  I left most of my burger in the basket.  I'll never order that again for the rest of my life.  The French fries were more like steak fries--no wonder the French were so annoy when American called it the French fries.  If I had known they were that thick and starchy, I would order sweat potatoes instead.  Another technician ordered a regular burger and told me that his burger tasted the same  as In and Out Burger.  We all think their food was just okay for a quick bite.

Imagine, meat so tender and juicy cooked to your preference, melted provolone cheese, grilled red onions, served with large tasty, refillable, err bottomless, steak fries. Sprinkle it with some Red Robin secret seasoning and you'll get lost in a trance of delicious-tasting goodness. Don't forget to wash it down with their famous, bottomless Freckled-Lemonade. Their fun and friendly service will leave you coming back for more! Red Robin really is "yummmmm"
This is my favorite chain restaurant. Endless fries plus one of the best happy hours ever. Nothing bad to say about this place.

I've been here several times. As the others have said, the service here is hit or miss. This time it was a miss.  In addition, there's signage everywhere touting the excellence of their burgers. Stuff like "voted best gourmet burger place" ..."Award winning.." "rated as Best Burger chain by Zagat 4 years in a row.." It's all over the place. Let me tell you something, these burgers are just okay. The meat for their burger is mediocre at best. In N Out is better, Wendy's is better, The Habit is better...a lot of other places are better.  I've dined here only because it's close to where my friend works. Also because I'm fat I'm too lazy and out of shape to walk the extra 100 feet to the Island's Restaurant next to it, which has better meat for their burgers. So this will be the last time I visit Red Robin, and I write this review to advise you not to waste your time or money on this place. I would've given this place 1 star but out of the 4 times I visited, 2 were visits that had really good service.

It had been a really long time since I had dined at Red Robin and I was really looking forward to eating there again.  The server was very nice, but I don't think the food runner was on his game.  When the food arrived at our table, about 25 minutes after ordering, it was clear that it had been sitting there, waiting to be delivered, for awhile.  I ordered the Burning Love burger and both the burger and fries were cold when they arrived, as were all the other burgers ordered at my table.  Additionally, the fried jalapeño slices on my burger were soggy, another indication that the food had been sitting there waiting for us.  My mom had the Bleu Ribbon burger and couldn't even taste the bleu cheese.  The burgers were really nothing special; this has not been my experience with RR in the past.  I will not be returning to this location.

I took my daughter and son-in-law to the Red Robin for lunch today. It was packed -- we had to wait about 15 minutes for a table. I got a mushroom burger, which was very good. Full of mushrooms. I ordered it with the side salad, which was very fresh and tasty. The kids liked their food too. So it was a success!  The restaurant is large, and the decor is kind of fun. Lots of pictures and photographs all over the walls. The bar looked very nice too, although we all just had iced tea. I would definitely go back!
The worst service I have ever received at any restaurant anywhere. I was called RUDE by the bartender Josh. Don't ever eat at this place!!!!!!

I just recently tried Red Robin as I'm not a big chain restaurant type of person. I now have lunch here 3-4 times per month. What really shocked me was the service. The waitstaff here is excellent. That is what truly keeps me coming back. I am also a big fan of the lunch portion Ensenada chicken platter. It is great!!! Pros: Service, service, service!!! Reasonably priced lighter fares. Ensenada Chicken!!! That salty blend of goodness in a shaker on every table! Cons: I just don't like chain type restaurants!
Good food, stiff drinks, and fantastic customer service!

My first stop back to one of these in a while.  They have changed their presentation to become more hipster.  No more baskets, it's a plate with a small vase shaped container with no bottom for the fries. Still bottomless fries. Quality and cook on the burger was good, service was good as well.

Carl's Jr. has a $6 burger which original idea was that a restaurant burger costs $6 but you can have one at CJ for a lot less.  Well, the next time I run into Carl, I'll ask him which full service restaurants have burgers for $6. Here at Red Robin, a plain vanilla burger is $9, and if you want toppings, it will run $10+.  It does not have a lunch menu (which Island's has) so there's no price break there for lunch.  So you begin to ask whether this burger that you are gobbling on is worth the money. The ambience here is nice but really nothing fancy.  It's a cool place but without a "wow" factor.  Service is adequate but not exceptional.  We came here during lunch hour and they seemed to be overwhelmed and understaffed.  Many empty tables were not cleared quickly enough so there's a short wait for a table. The burgers were good.  The Red Robin burger was tasty and was served with a tangy dressing which was yummy.  The mushroom burger was topped with a very generous serving of mushrooms (see picture).   The burgers were warm, not hot, so they have been sitting in the kitchen for a while.  However, the fries were hot and fresh from the fryer. One thing that Red Robin beats Island's hand down is that here they ask you "pink or no pink" so I won't forget to order my burger well done.  At Island's, burgers are served medium unless you specified, and there had been times I forgot to tell them I want it well done. Overall, it was an enjoyable lunch .  But for the price, it was just an average experience.

Amazing food! Just don't get the wings, but I don't expect food wings from anywhere that's not a wing place. The bruschetta chicken is what I normally get and I like to substitute sweet potato fries for steak fries. The spinach dip is just right. The salted caramel milkshake is too. Even the pretzel bites with beer cheese. I usually get pretty good service at RR, but as other reviewers said, it's hit or miss. My only 2 bad service experiences: Once I was in with my daughter for a beer and some spinach dip and pretzel bites. It was a special date for us, because her sister was with friends and dad was working, so it was just the two of us. We had said that we would be ordering dessert, but the server seemed in a hurry and took away our menu and dropped the check "no hurry" and ran. She was gone for so long leaving us without anything in front of us but empty glasses and plates. I saw her at the bar chatting with the bartender.  Eventually she came back and asked if everything was ok, so I told her we'd skip dessert and handed her my card. The next time was a Friday night, my beer was delivered in what seemed to be a glass fresh from the dishwasher...hot glass = warm beer. Not the server's fault, but she came back later to tell me now the keg was being changed. ...And then later to tell me it looks like the job is finally done. Still waiting... Meanwhile we had run out of chips for our spinach dip and looked around for a while with no help in sight.  So we usedd the celery to finsh the dip and still no drinkss. By that point we should have gotten our meals (kids meals and another appetizer which are the fastest foods in any restaurant) but we had not. We ended up leaving.

Good food.  Our family loves RR.  Their Red Royalty program is worth signing up for (it's free) if you are going to visit more often.   Our service was not great.  The waitress seemed quite distracted-nice but not focused.  Their manager looked like he had just come from a late 80's Van Halen concert.   Good enough for 4 stars though.

I'm a frequent Red Robin flyer and was new to this location.  It was busy, but as expected for a Saturday night.  We were still seated fairly quickly and our waitress was attentive and nice.  They made my burger correct to my special order and we took advantage of the refillable fries.  What I loved were all the new sauces you can get to dip your fries in.

We ate there over 6 months ago & they served raw chicken on my salad.  We stopped there tonight only because we needed to go to petsmart.  We should have known better.... Our order was wrong, fries were cold & the MANAGER was very RUDE & lacked intelligence.  We have lived in foothill for over ten years & will never go back  to Red Robin (unless I want to get a Red A--).  Save your time, money & smile on your face & eat at home.

Ordered my favorite A-1 Peppercorn last night, hubby ordered the season Smoke & Pepper and we were both disappointed.  Our burgers were both lukewarm.  The bun and bacon on my burger were room temperature at best.  The burger itself was warmish but the rest of it was not.  Hubby's cheese wasn't even melted on his burger.  We sent the food back and round 2 wasn't much better.  Bun was still cold and the bacon was worse than the previous sandwhich.  The meat part of the burger itself was hot but that was really it.   Overall disappointing.  I'd like to say we won't be back but hubby gets sucked in with the loyalty card freebies.

Went here for lunch on Sunday around 1pm. Service was sooo slow and bad. I understand if there are a lot of customers, but you still need to stay attentive to your customers. It took 45 min to get our food, burgers were cold and my salad was warm! They gave me lukewarm soup without crackers, when I was finally able to flag somebody down for some crackers they brought me an opened bag! Yuck. Another 30 min just to get a refill on our fries and our check. The manager was just standing around not helping his staff who were all running around. Poorly managed restaurant. Do not come during peak hours.

Food was just good but the blue moon beer shake was well worth the excess calories. The waitress Tess was awesome and made the recommendation on the beer shake. She also recommended the bmlt with chicken instead of turkey and campfire sauce for the fries. Both were excellent recommendations.

I LOVE Red Robin so it pains me to have to give this location a bad review. If you go there during the day, I think you're in the clear but going at night is a different story. I've gone there twice at night, fairly recently and have received cold, soggy fries with my entree. I mentioned my concern to a friend who had gone there a week or so after I did and had the same problem. I'll stick with the Irvine Spectrum location from now on. :(

This review is directed to our awesome waitress Patricia. She was very attentive and extraordinary. We did not even have to ask for refills before she brought them out. I was impressed with her service.  Food was good. I had the smoke&pepper burger, it was good. That came with bottomless fries which I always love and of course the strawberry lemonade. Yum! Anyway, thanks Patricia for such a great service!! :D

I LOVE this little piece of redneck heaven! it's funny that my husband and I have gone to some of the best restaurants in Socal yet we find this place always has the best service.  Food and drinks are great for your cheap all American burger joint.
The service here was really great. Tim (if I remember correctly) handled me take-out order and pick-up, and was very nice and helpful. Burgers continue to be pretty decent and fries are always a hit.

My family and I ate at this location yesterday.  We were greeted in the usual friendly manner and were seated within 5 minutes.  We were seated right in the middle of the restaurant where the tables are (more on that later). The individual who seated us, took our drink order and advised that a server would be by shortly.  A few minutes later, 2 of the 4 drinks ordered arrived.  This is where a 2 star review started (salvaged to a 5 star) during the process. We waited for about 20 minutes and still no server stopped by.  Sure, they passed us up as they waited on all of the tables next to us, but not even a hello, had you been waited on, etc.  Our menus were open and it was obvious we had not ordered yet. I went to the front desk, explained that we were sitting for 20 minutes, only 2 of the 4 drinks arrived and I POLITELY asked for a server.  I wish I can remember the manager's name (Rob maybe) but he got this eating experience back on track and to 5 stars, simply for the way the situation was handled. First major kudos to Patricia, who stepped up, apologized about the service and explained that she will take care of us.  By the way, she was not assigned to our area.  She was fantastic.  Corrected our drink orders, talk our food order, made sure everything was correct when it arrived and continued to check in throughout the meal.  Also, the manager, came back a few times to further apologize and also brought out a few apps to munch on while our order was prepared.   Not sure where the breakdown occurred, I think we were right in the middle of the floor in no man's land.  I have a great idea who should have served us, since she helped every table surrounding us, but I will reserve stating her name. In fact, this person brought out our meal, was very unfriendly which is likely because the manager wanted to know what went wrong and she took it out on us.  HOWEVER, that does not matter given how excellent the service was from Patricia who stepped up and took care of business.   It is team members like Patricia that bring people into restaurants.  She really cared about what happened and made things right.  I did not raise a stink, or get upset, or even ask for a discount or free food.  The manager and Patricia knew what to do to remedy the situation and just took care of business. So, from 2 stars to 5, based on service.  I ordered the whisky river BBQ burger which I have had the last 4 or 5 times I have been in and the food has been great and consistent each time.  The whole family enjoyed the food.

I used to love Red Robin but not so much anymore now... I ordered a cheese burger cooked to medium rare, and my friend ordered the same but well done. Both burgers were medium rare with too much creamy ranch-ish dressings on. I couldn't exactly point out what was wrong, but something tasted weird. My friend couldn't finish the burger. For the next two days, I had a bad stomach ache and felt nauseous.  I remember fries were cold the last couple of times I visited this location as well.  Maybe it's just this particular location because I remember the one in the Brea Mall was pretty good (though that was several years ago.)

Service was horrible took an hour to get our order. The waiter came by once and that's the last we saw of him. Then an Asian girl brings the food with an attitude and to top it off after waiting the bday boy didn't get his order. After all that they sent the manager to take care of us. He was nice but honestly the waiters are a joke! Go to islands next door instead

Eh second time here and still the service was not all that great.  The bartender is a nice guy but seems like he is doing way too much and looks like he kind of forgets things because of that. I ordered something to go but its because when i called to do take out i was on hold for way too long. Not sure if they are understaffed or not but them again the first time i came it was totally empty amd service was slow as molasses. For sure wont be going back anytime soon which sucks because the burgers are decent.

It's coming along here.  I am happy to see that the location is improving.  The manager at this location is different since my last visit.  He was present, working along side his employees as well as supervising.  I really think it makes a big difference.  Food was good...I am going to move them up on our casual family dining rotation!  Please keep it up.

I love the burgers here and the clucks and fries too.  Their shakes were a sweet treat to a lunch with my good friend Greg.  Conveniently located near our office, RR seems to be a solid go-to for lunch and even dinner for us.

Unfortunately, as many other reviewers have pointed out, this location has serious, systemic problems with service, even when it's not busy.  You might get lucky and get good service, but that's unlikely. I'm starting to think it's a management and/or training issue, because we've had several different servers, none of which seem to be interested in their work.  We live nearby and used to frequent this place, because when everything is done right, it can be an excellent place for kids and adults.  However, after several issues with different servers, we stopped going there.  Note that we are always extremely polite to servers, in part because we have kids and also because we've been in the service industry and know what it's like. A few months after our last failed attempt to have a good experience at this location, the six of us decided to try it again tonight... and unfortunately our decision to stop going to this restaurant was confirmed yet again.  When we arrived, the restaurant was less than half full (we counted about 10-11 groups and four to five servers).  Despite this, we waited for more than 10 minutes to be seated.  Once we were seated we ordered right away... because my spidey senses were tingling after waiting so long to be seated in a more or less empty restaurant. Despite ordering immediately, nothing happened for 10 minutes.  No drinks, no fries, nothing.  We were straight cold ignored. If you've ever been to Red Robin you know that one of the best parts about eating there is the bottomless basket of fries that you get after you order.  The timing of the fries, and whether you get them at all, of course depends on your server.   You can probably guess what happens next..  after we ordered, no fries. After about 10 minutes, we got... one small basket of fries for six hungry people. It lasted about 30 seconds.  In the meantime, other smaller groups seemed to get multiple baskets. Five minutes after that, we got drinks.  Those also lasted a just a minute or two.  No refills on fries or drinks for 10 minutes... since the server seemed stressed out about working two tables. In any case, the food finally came, and it was decent enough, although we waited about 25-30 minutes for it.  But the server forgot the appetizer we ordered.  No big deal, I understand it happens... plus they brought out a few onion rings on the house (thus saving this from being a one star review). Needless to say, we probably will not be back again, for at least several more months.  It's too bad, because we really like the food they serve.

I have eaten here twice, and both times I have sat at a table in the bar area.  The server was the same both times, and he is really nice and attentive.  I cant remember his name... maybe Justin or Kevin?  Or I could be totally wrong.  But he is always really friendly.  He helped me out with my Royalty card tonight, it somehow must have been switched at one point at another Red Robin, and it was invalid.  He was able to look it up by the number from an email I received for a free dessert... which was awesome. The only complaint I have is there is a sign at the entrance to the bar that says Adults only over 21, and I was asked if all parts of my party were over 21 before we were seated there... however right on the other side of the bar area was a child that screamed the entire hour plus we were in the restaurant.  It was really frustrating.  I realize a screaming child isnt the responsibility of the restaurant, but seating placement, is.  Also the last 15 minutes or so of our dinner tonight there were a few teenagers sitting at a table in the bar, with to go cups waiting for their table, and they were definitely not 21.

My boyfriend, his three children, and myself were hungry and decided to head on over to Red Robin for dinner.  When we got there, there weren't very many people in the restaurant, and I did see a lot of servers, and the bartender cleaning tables. We didn't get greeted at all. Instead, we waited around the lobby area waiting for a waiter/waitress to seat us. I thought that it was really strange that they wouldn't serve us right away, as it wasn't busy with about four parties in the restaurant. The employees there seemed to be meticulously cleaning as though they were about to close even though it was only 8:15pm.  About three minutes later, a busboy shows up and takes us to a table. He didn't greet us, he just placed some menus on a couple of tables and walked away without informing us when our actual server would be available.  Once he left, we realized that he didn't even leave us enough seating for our entire family. We ended up taking the empty table next to us and fit it to accommodate my boyfriend's teenage son.  And then we waited... and waited... and waited... and waited. No one ever showed up to take our drink order. No one ever showed up to hand us silverware. No one ever showed up to at least tell us their name. Instead, all we saw were a bunch of employees cleaning tables, and cleaning counters.  After about ten minutes of that bull, we decided we had it and just walked out of the restaurant. We didn't even get a server to ask us why we were leaving, we looked straight at them and they'd adjust their eyes somewhere else. It was really irritating as a willingly paying customer to not get any customer service from a restaurant that is supposedly supposed to be there for the customer.  Instead, we headed over to the local Island's and the service was amazing. As soon as we walked into the door, we were greeted and someone sat us right away. They handed us silverware, told us their name, took our drink order, and gave us time to take our order.  We told our waiter, Justin, about our terrible experience at this Red Robin, and he told me that we weren't even the first group of people to even complain about this today. We weren't really surprised when we heard this, but it made us feel validated hearing it.  Red Robin offers a lot of different options, and is generally a very family friendly place. This particular Red Robin though didn't even us let us have that experience because there were no servers available. What a complete and utter disappointment, if you're reading this Yelp review right now, just do yourself the favor and go somewhere else. Edit: 7/18/14 @12:09pm Just had the general manager call me about my experience, and I just had to change my review for him. He was VERY apologetic, making no excuses for his team's behavior and promised to make it better the next time we come to visit. I don't know if I'll be venturing there anytime soon, but I really appreciated the GM's quick response in handling the situation.  I really appreciate the fact that he took the time to call and talk to me about what had happened. Not a lot of companies would go out of their way for their customer like that, but this time around, even though I'm still disappointed, I'm really grateful that the man did everything he did to make me happy.

Its been 20 minutes and no one has taken my drink order and much less my order. I wont be coming back ever. One of the waitresses kept looking at my direction and even if its not her area helped or made aware of whos area it is that there's a new customer seated.

After a long break from such horrible service in the past thought we would give it another go. I had to change it up a bit from my regular Blue Ribbon Burger to the Colossus Burger. The Colossus was not what I expected probably should have ordered this particular Burger well done instead of medium. Burger was soggy and should be expected seeing it had BB Q sauce on it. In the photo it shows Brisket, When I received my burger there was Brisket but was nothing like the photo as expected. Next time I will stick to the Blue Ribbon. Service was outstanding. The server was awesome. Think her name was Patricia. I with the service that I received today I will definitely go back as I use to do on our Friday lunches.  FYI if you want Hot fries make sure you let your server know not to send out fries that are cold. Give them a heads up just as you would like them to give you great service. If you get great service and you are please show them with your gratuity. Thanks The Animal
Turkey burgers are moist and delicious. Service is friendly and prompt. Great atmosphere for the entire family.  Kids love the menu choices too.

My husband and I visited on a Thursday during lunch hour rush. We were seated right away, we waited a while and our waiter never came. We were thinking of leaving soon because we sat so long without being helped. Soon after we thought this our waiter comes rushing over, apologies right away, gets our drink and appetizer order and rushes off. My husband had noticed him before rushing around non stop.  He comes back with our drinks and appetizers, he bends down and asks if we are ready to order. It was very noisy and Todd, our waiter's name, was very tall. He knelt down so we could hear each other. He got our order and rushed off.  While we were waiting for our food we over heard a female waitress with a short bob giving some customers some attitude. A table next to us asked if they were real onions or something about the onions, and she gives them attitude and says, "Well this is a REAL burger place so EVERYTHING is real." Very snotty. Our food comes and everything was made to order and delicious. After he dropped off our food he brought us both new drinks(we didn't even have to ask!), he had also brought us new silverware after we ate our appetizer. When finished he brings us to go boxes and our bill. We thought we had to pay up from so we walked up there because he was so busy. I asked a shorter, chubby waitress and she said our waiter had to take it, but not too nicely. Todd was already there so he took our bill to cash us out. My husband handed him his tip and when he noticed it was a generous tip he became even more thankful than he already was, he was so incredibly pilot the ENTIRE time we were there!  Todd was constantly on the go, he was on top of everything, we didn't need to ask for anything, he did the extra work himself to make sure the customers were happy and enjoying their lunch. Even with the place being packed and loud my husband and I had an absolutely amazing lunch because of Todd's service.  When visiting this location ask for Todd's section, you will not be disappointed! Kind and wonderful man!

My family and I usually come in twice a month,  Recently the service has been very poor.  Our last two experiences have been over the top though. Both times we had rude people waiting our table.  On top of that it took them forever to bring the food out. Both times we went in around 5pm and it left over two hours later! Service and speed needs to improve here.
Um yeah anytime a place has endless anything, I'm there!!! The endless steak fries are awesome!!! And the veggie burger was one of the best I've had! Very nice place, a little loud but not too bad.

Okay right off: if you're a carb counter, don't even think about eating here! The food is delicious and plentiful, good service, love the strawberry lemonade but my god do you get filled up. I recently ordered the fried chicken salad which was so tasty my mouth actually watered. But compared to the burger and fries my fiance ordered it had 500 more calories. God. Okay just means extra biking to work it off. But it was soooo worth it.

We just had the worst experience ever!  First we waited a long time to even order then when we got our food the burger was raw.  Sent it back twice & it was still raw.  We didn't want to give it a 3rd try.  They didn't comp our meal only took off the burger & kids meal.  Ridiculous!  Terrible customer service.  We won't be going back to this location.

Red Robin has probably the BEST burgers around.  I like how they are constantly changing up the menu, too, with new burgers and pairing them with beers.  Good beer selection also.  And Josh the bartender deserves special recognition here!  He is very friendly, and makes awesome drinks!  I know, the word awesome is over-used, but it applies in his case, JOSH IS THE MOST EXTREME AWESOMEST!  Yeah, I made up the word.

You get two stars for the delicious burgers and zero stars for the lousy service. Unfriendly host, no air conditioning in bar area, dirty bathrooms, and nice servers who are over extended and cannot really give each table proper attention. Oh, and did I mention our burgers and fries were cold because they must have been sitting in the kitchen for a while before being brought to the table? Love the burgers but hate the service.

Over 35 minutes after ordering to get a salad and 2 sandwiches....they didn't bring ANY of the 3 kids meals. The manager I spoke with was Tommy, rear manager Rob was on hand, and our waiter Tim sadly was friendly but out of the loop. At 7pm at night with a 50% filled dining room with plenty of staff on hand, this should NOT occur. The manager pulled the receipt and apparently it took the waiter 15 min after taking the order to input the order to the kitchen. Very bad experience here- really could use better management!

It took 45 minutes to get our food and there was only one other table with people on a Wednesday night at 8pm. The waiter was nice but he should have given us more fries at least while we were waiting for our food since we had "endless fries" ordered anyway instead of just coming by and saying sorry it was taking so long. Not his fault the kitchen was lagging, but just saying service on his part could have been better. Once we did get our burgers they were good. Nothing to wow about, but decent.  That's all I have to say about this place. I probably won't be back again since there are so many other places to get a good burger with better service. If we do go to a Red Robin, we'll probably go to the one at the Spectrum.

Whoever answers the phone talks too fast!  I was on hold for seven minutes to place a phone order. When she finally came back to the phone I was helping my daughter in the bathroom, I asked her to hold on just a minute...then she put me back on hold!  It's the afternoon and in between the lunch and dinner rush. Are they so short handed they can't help someone on the phine?  Service is always slow when I'm inside the restaurant so i shouldn't be surprised at the lack of standards on the phone.  I'm going to Chili's instead.
Never again. Burnt soup "to go" no seasoning or salt on fries ughhh thanks for nothing. What a waste of hard earned $!!

The food was okay the fries were a little bit soggy the salad that I got was a Caesar salad there's a little bit too wet croutons a little bit stale I don't want to complain because I was hungry and I was with a friend but this voice in my mind

Sean the bartender has the best customer service what an asset to the company. He always made sure I had everything I need and was nice enough to put the football game on for me. I will be coming back here due to the great customer service he not only gave me but the customers around me. If you come here make sure to have Sean help you out.
Crappy service, raw burger, and we are still waiting for our to go boxes...would rather go to In-N-Out (and saved $60+)

Came on a Friday afternoon and this place was hopping. It was a 20min wait for a table for 2.  So we decided to sit in the bar area, thinking we could get in n out faster.     It was 1 girl working the bar and the tables.  When she finally came to take our drink order we were already to give our food order.   We waited 20 min for the food to arrive and she came with drink refills, but after that she was unable to get back to us.  She was definitely hustling but it  was way to many customers for just 1 person to handle.    All in all we were out of here in 50 min.
We really enjoyed all the menu options and atmosphere. Service was a good team effort and the food was what we expected.

We went in to be seated at 745 on Thursday night. They were not busy. Yet lots of employees walking all over and no one greeted us for 5 mins. We just left chillis. They were busy and no one greeted us at our table. We came here because it is our old standby. One of the boys working walked past is and said just one min. Wondering what was so important that he could not help us. No hostess seen there tonight.

I was truly disappointed with my last visit here. To start, their hostess was rude and was not welcoming, but my biggest disappointment was the food. I ordered a chicken burger and the chicken was not cooked properly. It tasted rubbery and looked pinkish inside. I waited around for my waitress to come by and check in, and she didn't. The gal who was cleaning the tables saw i was not happy with my meal and actually assisted me instead. I switched my meal to a regular burger instead, but it too wasn't great. The patty itself had no seasoning and it tasted like i was eating dirt. The only thing it gave this burger some flavor was all the cheese it came with. And to top it off, i thought they would have given us a discount, but nope, they charged the entire meal. This will definitely be my last visit.

This review has to do with their customer service, rather than their food. A couple months ago, I chose to celebrate my actual birthday with my husband at Red Robin. I had signed up that morning for the Royalty card which was promptly confirmed on my phone via email. This gives you a free burger on the day of the your birthday - a nice gesture for loyal customers, I thought.  Upon arrival we were seated by our server and before I ordered anything, I checked with our server to confirm we would be able to receive the free burger by showing him the email confirmation. We were excited to enjoy a little freebie on my birthday so we order an additional item. After we enjoyed our meal and went to pay the bill, the server then said that because I signed up the day-of, it doesn't take effect for 24 hours, even though I received the email. I had not read any such thing when I signed up and had reminded him that I had checked with him, and he had said we were good. He got his manager who decided to dig in his heels too. So, instead of doing the right thing to make amends for the mistake by the server, the manager chose to make me feel bad (on my birthday) and we paid for the burger. He acted like we were trying to take advantage of them somehow. It's a burger, not a car. Perspective. The point is, out of all the places we could have gone to celebrate a birthday on the actual day, I chose to celebrate with my husband at their establishment. And all I got was bad customer service and left feeling hurt. They didn't honor their word or their Royalty card. Never again. They have lost our patronage. And when I contacted customer service via email, the "customer service representative" obviously misread my email and offered an explanation that had nothing to do with what I wrote. When I wrote back to clarify, I never received a response. I'm writing now because it still bothers me and I want others to know what customer service should NOT look like. Hopefully they take this as a coaching tool for their employees and managers. Too bad we won't be around to see if they made any changes.

Horrible experience tonight. Usually, their service is pretty decent but our server seemed to be off. We sat for a good 10-15 minutes before we were greeted and offered drinks, another 10 to order food. After our food was delivered, we never saw him again. Not to mention, my sons mac and cheese was delivered in a bag which sat in a bowl!! (See picture attached). I looked around for a manager to help us out, but I didn't see one around. I settled by asking another server for my bill.  Don't know if I'll come back to this location.

I don't normally write reviews for chains, but I've never seen such hustling from one Waiter before in my life. We dined on 3-5-15 at 8pm and Todd clearly had too many tables. He kept composure and served each efficiently, thank you so much. The manager on the other hand clearly doesn't deserve the title. Everyone was clearly overwhelmed with service and he didn't lift a finger.  5+stars to Todd. Thank you for a wonderful experience.

I usually go here for large work lunch groups. Tonight my daughter picked it. The food overall is good, but you have to stick to their signature items such as burgers and chicken sandwiches. Salads don't disappoint either. But mixed seafood bake and pizza, especially pizza, don't bother. My son usually eats anything and isn't too picky but tonight he wouldn't eat his pepperoni pizza. It's quite similar to a cheap frozen pizza from the supermarket.  I had a new crabcake sandwich which was good. The ciabatta bun was great. The dungeneous crab cake was crisply fried on the outside and had okay crab flavor, but a bit too much filling. The veggies and sauce were tasty. Fries were bit undercooked. The ranch dressing is great.  Our waitress was very good. She was friendly and handled our many requests nicely. She brought my wife lots of lettuce leaves upon request to go with her fish sticks. The seafood bake is not great. The seafood has an off-taste. The breading is excessive. None of us got burgers this time, but they are very good and I recommend sticking with them and asking for fries cooked bit extra, and ask for side of ranch. Want more frys? No problem, bottomless. My daughter got a shake which was pretty good - I prefer Chic-fil A. There is happy hour which is good in the dining room.

Bruschetta Chicken Sandwich is grilled chicken breast topped with fresh bruschetta salsa, pesto aioli, provolone, romaine lettuce, and balsamic cream on rustic ciabatta. The chicken breast is tender and juicy. The provolone is lovingly melted and encases the chicken breast like a blanket. The pesto, bruschetta, and balsamic are bursting with flavors of Italy with a perfect balance of sweet, savory, herbaceous freshness. Rating: 4.5/5 Prime Chophouse Burger is a fire-grilled burger layered with horseradish-sautéed mushrooms, gourmet steak sauce, provolone, country Dijon, and crispy onion straws on an onion bun. Red Robin's burgers are always juicy and meaty. I like to order my burgers at a medium rare temperature to keep it juicy when it gets to the table. The sautéed mushrooms pair well with beef patty. The provolone melts just enough to cover the mushrooms like a cheese dome. I thought that there was too much sauce on this burger. I think if they stick with just the steak sauce, it would be fine. The Dijon is too strong and does not pair well with the rest of the flavors on this burger. I think if they did a pork-inspired burger or sandwich, the Dijon would pair nicely. The crispy onion straws on my burger were also soggy and not crispy. It would have been nice to have a crispy texture on this burger. The onion bun is awesome! It has just the right amount of onion flavor and the texture is soft like it was just out of the oven. Rating: 3.5/5 BLTA Croissant Sandwich is a combination of turkey breast, hardwood-smoked bacon, mayo, lettuce, tomato, and avocado. It reminded me of a time I used to work at Café Orleans in Disneyland. We made a sandwich called the Croissant Mardi Gras and it was a similar blend of flavors. But Red Robin's BLTA is more sophisticated with thicker slices of turkey, smoky bacon, and creamy avocado. It's simple, but very tasty. Our server was awesome to replace the fries with a cup of the Clamdigger's Clam Chowder, making our Café Orleans remake complete. The clam chowder is creamy and has a healthy serving of clams inside. Rating: 5/5 A.1. Peppercorn Burger is topped with hardwood smoke bacon, melted pepper jack, A.1. peppercorn spread, tomatoes, and crispy onion straws. I ordered it with a lettuce wrap so I could use my carb count for the fries. This is a definitely a steakhouse burger! The A.1. peppercorn sauce works well with the burger. It felt like I was in a Carl's Jr. commercial as all of the sauce squirted all over my hands. It's a hot mess, but worth it. Just ask for extra napkins! My onion straws were crispy this time so the crispy onion flavor and texture worked perfectly with the burger. Rating: 5/5 Chili Chili Cheeseburger is served open-face topped with Red's Chili Chili, cheddar cheese, chipotle aioli, and diced red onions. This is definitely a knife and fork burger. The chili is a little thin. I think if it were a little thicker, it would cling better to the burger. The chili itself has a really rich, kettle cooked flavor. A good point is that you can rescue the escaping chili with the fries to make your own make-shift chili cheese fries. Rating: 4.5/5

Haven't been to a Red Robin in years.  I was suprised by the reasonable prices.  Happy hour appetizers are the bomb.  $3 wedge is my favorite - all the toppings you can't believe it's only $3!!!!  The service is pretty good, bartenders are super friendly & pour great drinks.  Give it a shot if you haven't given a "franchise" place a chance in a while - you won't be disappointed - I hope!!  Lol!
Service was good and quick food came out hot and was very tasty. Everything about dinner here for me was good. Eat with confidence.
Tvs at the bar are tiny. I need binoculars to watch the basketball game. Service is great though

I've been to many Red Robin Restaurants, Bonsai Burgers baby.  Unfortunately this one is horrible. Seriously someone needs to help them. I've been here 3 times, giving it a chance, and every time it's a mess. Food  comes out under cooked and wrong. One time I saw a server wipe a mess up off the floor and then go wipe a table with that same towel. THEN, they sat a family at that table.. The tables always smell like  sour wash rags, now we know why...It's just nasty. I'll never go there again AND I'm telling everyone I know.. You have 1 job kids, get it together!

I want to dislike this place because it's a big, annoying chain, but it's pretty good. I am always satisfied with the giant salad I order and the servers are very friendly to my kid. I have usually received good service and have had no issues with the food, beyond ordering something new that was greasy and mediocre, but I should have known better.

I love coming here. The food is always amazing. I think the burgers are the best and we are always happy with the service. The price is never too bad either. It's a fun place to come with family or on a date. The drinks are not too bad either.

(Location being inept = 0 stars) (Food and Server = 4 stars) Manager needs to stop hiding in his restaurant.  Come in mid week 1PM not full yet 15 min wait. Is the manager clueless on staffing? Half full = not making money as it should while people wait.  Red Robin corporate needs to do more surprise visits of sub par locations. Host was also clueless and unsure of his job and had communication skills that aren't right for the job. Our server redeemed this partly.  She took our drink order quick (and food since we had a long wait for table and knew what we wanted) Server took a bit to get drinks as it looked like she had lots of tables to work but was with us in a reasonable time. Food was OK as it should be. Really won't be coming back here again.  This was our 2nd re-try at this location. Last time was just as bad. I get this is a casual sit down but I've never seen such clueless management at other busier Red Robin locations (eg one near South coast plaza).  Wake up Red Robin HQ and hire location managers who aren't inept and inspect service levels. No excuse for the poor initial service.

I would give 0 start if I could, on their bottomless fries. Party of 11....9 ordered menu items that included fries, pretty cheap on the bottomless refills. Very slow on refills too, PLUS NOT THAT BUSY
Three times in a row w/bad service all around. Think I would learn, but I keep hoping they'll match the service at Spectrum.

We came to Red Robin to celebrate a graduation today, and was very disappointed to the service. I asked for sweetener for the Tea, and didn't get it until I asked again.  I let that go, until we asked for a third plate of the "bottomless fries" and got the comment from the server "Again?" That was totally uncalled for.
This location (foothill ranch) is my 2nd favorite (spectrum number 1) service is always on point. Food always amazing . Always walk out full and happy

My boyfriend and I arrived at around 730 PM on a Monday night and were immediately greeted by the friendly hostess, which is where our positive experience ends. We were then sat in the bar area, where we proceeded to wait 15 minutes before the hostess came back and asked us if we had gotten drinks yet. When we told her no, she was kind enough to bring us a couple of sodas and informed us our server would be right with us. Our server finally showed up only to help another table that was seated 10 minutes after us first. He eventually came and took our order but when the food arrived it was incorrect. Our server was no where to be found so we settled for the incorrect food. When we finished, the buss-boy came and cleared our plates where we then waited another 10 minutes for our server. He then comes up and asks if ever got our food (how do you not know if your table got their food??) and when we said yes and he then asked us if we wanted more fries after our plates had been cleared. He also explained that he had to take a very important call and he asked someone to watch his station. Understandable, however it seemed the manager went to every other table but ours. Overall, the experience was just awful. The hostess was a better server than ours. Definitely won't be back for awhile.

Really great burgers and bottomless fries are too die for but be sure to look at the calorie sheet before you get something if your the kind of person who cares about that. Most of the food is freakishly high in calories

I must say my wife and I come to this location quite a bit & from the looks of it there was a big face lift regarding the employees.  The manager on duty, I had never seen before and there was servers all over the place. People were buzzing around and orders were hitting the tables rather quickly. Different energy around this place than usual. We were served quickly and the food was great.  I'm giving 4 stars because our server had too many tables but still made it a point to make us feel good!! Will be back!!
Slow service. Didn't get what I ordered. Had to ask multiple times for iced tea. My friend asked for a refill on fries and was brought diet coke instead

We went to Red Robin for lunch just before noon yesterday.  My wife and I were visiting our daughter and her family in Portola Hills, and went to Red Robin because they are kid-friendly. It was a Saturday, and there were 4 adults and 3 children in our party.  Everything was fine through the point that we placed our order.  It took quite a while to receive our order, but we were looking forward to a nice meal.  My wife and I did not have a lot of time to spend, so we just wanted to have our lunch and then be on our way. Problem one:  Grandson's order was completely wrong, and had to be re-made.  So much for a quick lunch. Problem two:  I ordered one of the pricey hamburgers, and specified "well done."  What I received was a sandwich that was only a half-step above raw hamburger.  Really, what I got might have been a health hazard.  By this time, we did not have time to wait for a re-do.  The waiter did take this item off the check, but no lunch for me. Problem 3:  The service staff was totally overwhelmed.  They were working very hard, but could not keep up. Problem 4:  My daughter asked for more water for her three kids.  Kids are given mini-water glasses which run out quickly.  One of the service people finally filled my daughter's glass and quickly ran off, but did not fill the children's glasses. The last issue was really funny to us, considering the rest of the meal.  I finally received the bill.  I pressed the button on the supplied ball point pen so that I could add the tip, and the ink cartridge shot out of the pen and ended up in the middle of the aisle!  I finished the tip with my own pen.  Yes, I did give a tip because the servers were working very hard, but I wish that I could have given a negative tip for the kitchen and management. My suggestion is to avoid this restaurant whenever it is likely to be busy.  Also, plan enough time so that your raw hamburger can be re-made.

I have always been a fan of Red Robin, cheap burgers and unlimited fries - plus I love their ranch. I've tried this location four times now, first time was a huge disappointment - they were under staffed and our server seemed as though she didn't know the menu and had the quietest voice in the world! If anyone knows this place its that its loud around dinner time with all the kids (I felt awful having to ask her to repeat everything she was saying). Second time was a late lunch so they weren't as busy, I came with my mother in law who has a thick accent and the server seemed so frustrated every time she asked her a question that she couldn't understand (I would then tell the server what she asked so she could respond) but you could tell our server was thoroughly irritated by all the questions (not our fault if we don't know the menu and have questions).  Third time we got food delivered and it was actually good as we didn't have to deal with the restaurant experience. Fourth time was yet another disappointment, my friend and I ordered the same burgers - mine well done, hers was supposed to be pretty damn pink and what do you know it wasn't even though when they brought the burgers out they specified which was well done and which wasn't. I ordered an overpriced mojito which tasted likes watered down nothing, BUT I can say our server was nice and paid attention to our table so that made up for it a little.

Twice in the past few months we have visited this Red Robin. First time we were seated and forgotten about for 30 minutes. We just got up and left, clearly we were not going to be waited on. Tonight we waiting for 10 minutes to even see a hostess. Once she appeared it was a long wait to be seated. It was 7:00 and 1/2 the tables were empty. Choose to go to Island next door. It is clear Red Robin is failing with low staffing resulting in long waits to check in and to be seated. Didn't want to have to have a long wait for my food too. Avoid it. Save your time and money and find another burger place.

Ok, lots of new staff. Wait for seat ok 5 stars. Wait for waiter 5 stars. Waiter Cesar, recently promoted from bus boy was awesome, attentive and friendly 10 stars.  Congrats Cesar. Kitchen staff...-5 stars.  2 of 4 meals ordered bad. Mini corn dogs looked like mini red lava rocks. French dip, tepid with congealed cheese. My soup and salad awesome. Daughters Mac n cheese warm and ok. Again Cesar was great kept trying to point out ways to get cheaper meal for daughter rather than ala cart style off kids menu, she likes her Mac and broccoli! The manager Umberto came over and gave no excuses. Very straight shooter and empathetic to our situation. French dip remade and good. Mini corn dogs double reorder one to go! On the house! All wait staff and bus people busy and a lot of helping of one another , that says a lot and shows great team effort. Keep up the awesome work and keep in mind, every day is and opportunity to improve on yesterday. Many Thanks Umberto, Cesar and Sean. I'm forgetting Hostess and another waitress but I think Sean knows...lol.

I was so disappointed! I've had their garlic fries before and they were always really good. There was NO garlic at all. Instead, they sprinkled very little garlic salt and then charge .99 for the "garlic" addition to my fries.

I hate the new automated system.  This system allows the already lazy servers to get more lethargic. I've always had my reservations about the inconsistent customer service, but this new systems confirms I will not be going back any time soon. I'm most upset with the 2.00 entertainment charge for the video console.  I went with my 10 year old daughter who immediately grab the system and started playing.  I had no Idea that there was a charge, until we received the bill. Server had no idea how to use the system.  Terrible customer service!!
5 stars...because Rebeccah is just amazing.  Every time we come here for lunch, she makes it's worth the drive.

I don't know why, but this place always feels dirty. Like the tables and floor seem sticky. Also, they have a horrible draft beer selection. The food is fine. We usually drive a little further to a different location.

I have been to many Red Robin Restaurants in my day.... And this one by far is the WORSE! Before I focus on the negative, I would like to thank our server Allison for her service! (She was the ONLY server working the dining room at the time we came in and was taking care of over 10 tables). She did a lot! PROPS TO YOU ALLISON! I've always been a fan of the shroom burger and the whiskey river bbq burger(my girlfriend's choice). The burgers were just ok this time.... My fries were stale and cold.... And the broccoli that my girl got were cold too. We got refills from Allison, but still.... the sides were horrible again. As for MANAGEMENT and the serving staff.... They need to bulk up with more servers working. I believe that some of the staff were having a training thing going on when we came in at one of the tables...... Here's some advice.....DON'T SCHEDULE TRAININGS DURING PEAK HOURS AND ADD MORE SERVERS TO HELP OUT ALLISON.....1 SERVER ISN'T ENOUGH!

We have given this place several chances.  We have enjoyed other Red Robins, but this one does not measure up.  The employees often say "no" to special requests.  They run out of seasonal beers.  The food is usually served up cold and tasteless.  This is definitely the worst store in the chain.

Wow, a lot of harsh 1-star reviews as of late... I don't get it? I've come to this location a couple times in the past couple months and haven't had a single bad experience. I like this location because it never gets as crowded as the Spectrum or the one by South Coast Plaza.  The onion rings and chicken wings are still pretty amazing here. I'm a huge fan of the ghost tavern double burger - super tasty, spicy, w/ two patties & fried AND fresh jalapeños, and it's under 600 calories! And of course, they have bottomless fries. I don't think I've ever asked for a refill, though. The guilt would be too much. The regular seasoned steak fries are yummy but now they also have sweet potato fries and garlic Parmesan, too. Writing this out is making my mouth water... Anyhoo, the Foothill Town Center offers a lot of different dining options - Red Robin is not a bad choice at all. I usually pick this place over Islands (if I'm in the mood for a burger). And now with the self serve kiosks at each table, the service is quicker if you wanna pay quick and get out. Red Robin rocks.
Extremely slow service probably due to being understaffed. Quite possibly the worst Red Robin I've been to.

Let me start by saying my family and I love red robin and we eat there at least once a month. However, this time will be our last. We arrived around 4:30pm on a Friday evening. We were sat immediately and brought drinks. We then ordered our food, and asked for a basket of fries which came out cold and under cooked they said they would bring us out more but never did. About 40 minutes go by and our food still hasn't came out. We looked around the restaurant and there wasn't very many people inside. We called our waitress over and said "what's up? We've been waiting an hour" she replied "the kitchen lost your ticket. Would you like to speak to our manager?" My dad said, "yes please" Finally an hour later my plate comes and again, the fries are soggy. I politely asked if I could have some need fries our waitress of course said yes and brought them back. During this time my parents and my little brothers meals still have not arrived. 10 minutes later the rest of the food arrives but my little brothers burger is wrong and my dad's burger has pink in it when he asked for no pink. Another 10 minutes go by and the manager brings the rest of the food, and my brothers burger was still incorrect. He apologized multiple times and took off our entire meal. A few moments later our waitress came to apologize to us again. This isn't the first time we have received sh*tty service from this location either. There is too many other good burger joints in this area. Save yourself the money and go to in n out instead.

Went in here last night. The service was (and is always) great. We haven't been to this location in a few years, and had a favorite waitress. She still works there!! Unfortunately I don't think she recognized us, but we were delightfully happy to see her! The food was very good, and the yummy fries were a plentiful. We love this location. WILL be returning.

The food prevented this from being a 1 star, sort of.  Server had no personality and didn't seem to care about us or even make sure we had place settings. He forgot our order and was boring. We asked for fries to start and he forgot. He apologized which was great but he brought us cold fries. Checked in once and was more interested in who he was texting. Thanks, I know the ziosk works but you don't need it to do your job. Personality makes up for poor or inexperienced service, and as a server was extremely disappointed by my visit.
Red Robbin is the ONLY restaurant in Foothill Ranch that I would NOT visit again.  The service is always sub-par and the food is typical greasy spoon burgers.  Try Islands or Chili's instead.

HORRIBLE!!  If I could give negative stars I would!  Went on a Wednesday night, slow with lots of opened tables.  First, the hostess made us wait while she figured with wood dice with letters , before she took us to the table.. Just could not do that later?  Seriously, it was a slow night!  We waited and no one came by, while other customers were being seated and helped with drinks etc.  A random server came by, said she wasn't our server but brought water and took order.  Waiting a LONG time again.  Server who was helping another table near us, isn't she suppose to be our server? Said you've been waiting long and I will have a manager come to talk to us.  What?  She didn't even ask us if she can help or what our problem was!  And what happened to the food we ordered?  It was on that stupid tablet they have on the table!?  Is that there so they have an excuse to provide zero customer service?! BTW. I saw an "entertainment" fee on the tablet.  Where does it say they charge to play games on it?? This place is RIDICULOUS!!  Fire the manager, who never came to talk to us.  This place is a total embarrassment to the chain...Heads-up corporate!!!!  We walked out, and I will definitely let everyone I know what a joke this place is!

Remington was the best part of today! Such great service! She was pretty busy but made sure to get us everything quickly & checked in with us.  Food was same as always. Good but nothing too write home about. Although the sweet potato fries were delicious!  Bummer the Patriots game wasn't on there today. They only have regular cable for sports events.

Well.......I won't be back. I feel like Will Ferrel in ELF. Remember? Worlds greatest coffee? Self proclaimed 'World's greatest gourmet burger maker'? Not! Service: definitely acceptable. Few issues such as lack of napkins, but overall not bad.  Food: hot but undercooked fries, very greasy burger, ciabatta bun not toasted as advertised and didn't seem fresh. Late items. I realize we were a big party (15) but come on.  Desserts: too sweet, and putting salt on something doesn't make it automatically a hit.  Sad, very sad.

Some days I wake up and crave Red Robin's clucks n fries and a cold strawberry lemonade. And on these days I just can't not deny myself.. The location is clean and staff was efficient. I wouldn't say they were particularly friendly but they were not rude either.  Food was ok... The fries were a little soggier than normal.  I left full and craving satisfied for today.  We will most likely return as it is close and I love the chicken tenders!

One star is for the food quality. Our entrees were good and had good flavor.  Service on the other hand was below par! Rude, unfriendly and ignorant staff. We asked for Jalapeños on the side with our burger which never came with our food. When the server came we asked and she said of "it never came let me check" few minutes and half burger later she came back with 5-6 slices of fresh slices jalapeños(see pictures) not the traditional pickled ones and was charged 99 cents for them; Really!!!! After food was delivered our server only came once to check on us and asked if we needed anything else and told us we can also pay our bill using the fancy tablets or order additional food items or desert if we like. At 9:28pm we added a desert using the gadget. At 9:48pm nothing arrived so we called and got the attention of her after several attempts and asked what happened to the desert I ordered. She apologized and said "let me check what happened". We told her don't worry about it now and take it off the check so that we can pay and leave. It took her a while for it to remove and finally after 9 minutes she returned with revised check. Our bill was $42.49 and Yes I paid for jalapeños which should have been removed from the check since they never arrived with initial food order.  I wouldn't recommend this place due to lousy service! Did I mention they were dead with only 3 tables to serve in the entire restaurant.

Thank you Kiersten for the great service. The food was was delicious & the service was excellent. I love coming to Red Robin and my family and I will continue to come. It's nice to come and enjoy a good meal with a friendly smile, you deserve 5 stars!

I would give 100 stars if I could. Tricia was amazing as she helped us plan a Red Robin meal for my son's funeral service. It was his favorite and was very special to have for our family and friends who gathered with us. The Foothill Ranch staff was incredible, wonderful, kind, helpful, and every other positive word I can think of. We are so grateful for all they did to make everything perfect during a very difficult time. Above and beyond. Thank you, Red Robin!!!
Food good, my burger was cooked my way, it makes me sad, not angry about the service, still waiting for my bottomless fries..... this people need to smile a little bit more.

Came here last night with my husband to use our gift card.  Better experience than last time, we got seated right away and our appetizer came out well in advance compared to our meal.  The only problem we had was when we order more bottomless fries it took like 15 minutes to get them for both of us and we waited a little while for our bee refills couldn't reorder those on the little table thing so we had to wait for 15 minutes for our waitress to notice our little light was blinking saying we wanted something  so that was disappointing but the rest of the experience was good.

Don't expect much customer service wise from this location; both dine-in and take out. Food is good, typical Red robin. But Not sure why they're so rude here. Make sure you check your order because they can't even take orders correctly. Just wasted my money. Don't they work for tips? Smh...

The only reason I am rating two stars instead of one is because I have been here before and had decent, normal service. Tonight was the exception. We sat in the bar- I'm wondering if that was the reason for the crappy service. Our waiter was either never trained or simply doesn't care. I won't post his name here because I'm not sure what the reason was for his apathy. He forgot everything we asked for and had to be reminded, he never asked how our meal was, never offered refills or asked if we wanted anything else- I was with two others that would have purchased a few more beers. He never cleared plates, never brought the check and when asked for it kept telling us to pay via the device on the table. I had a coupon, one of us was paying in cash so we wanted the printed bill. That's when he did get an attitude but we were already done dealing with him and wanted to leave. We actually went to another restaurant for dessert and coffee.  You can see from my check ins that I've been here multiple times- it's very sad that this type of service is tolerated. I can't imagine that the manager has ever watched this guy wait tables. If they had, he would have been retrained or fired. I watched three other tables pay their check on the device with empty water glasses and plates still on the table, left only to pay and leave without any "service" from the waiter.
The burger came with paper from the cheese separator in it. Disgusting!!!!!!!!!! The waitress took it back as if nothing happened. Not even a sorry from the manager.

Service is pretty terrible. We tried to contact our waiter and kept asking him for something small and he forgot about 6 times. Food is kind of bland here, but it isnt bad. I prefer to have better service, food isnt spectacular here either. The other Red Robin further towards Irvine has better quality and portions. Portions here are not spectactular. The Red Robin in Spectrum is the Worst though.

Update to previous review: adding two stars. Service and speed has gotten way better here. Still hostesses are not friendly, so not 5 stars, but food and service was great. They need training for their staff. Rude hostesses, rude servers. If we don't get a specific 2 people there we can know it will be a bad experience.  It just seems like lack of customer service training.
This review is for Todd!! He was very attentive, and provided great all around service from start to finish. He made our visit very enjoyable!

The service here has gotten to be painfully slow.  Most of the time, food orders come out incorrect or improperly cooked.  Quality of the food has also suffered recently.  I won't be coming back to this location any time soon.

Service is not very good. Would not recommend. Been here multiple times and we keep telling ourselves maybe it was a off day, but something is always wrong from a ice cold French fry to cold macaroni or a meal that was ordered and forgotten.
