They should just call your number and have you get your own food at this place. A new manager with customer service is needed to address these issues.

Excellent!!  I got the chili chili cheeseburger with fries.  It was so tasty, but our server, Katylin was on top of everything. Quick with the drinks, the food, and the refills.  She even happily got the Angels baseball game on the tv for me.

.....Do yourself a favor.  Walk over to In-N-Out and get your burger and fries.  The food is better, the service is better and your wallet will appreciate it.   .....I have come here about 3 or 4 times during the holiday season and each time come away with the same impression.  Food is good if it is hot, Service is slow, one server argued with me that there weren't suppose to be mushrooms on my burger and after I showed her the menu, she decided to take the burger back and give me what I ordered.  I have gone there another time and no one was there to greet anyone or seat anyone for ten minutes. .....Honestly, if this place was better managed, I think it would do better.

Quite a shame that on a recent visit we discovered that red Robin discriminates against families with children by making them wait longer than necessary by refusing to seat them in an area that is bar adjacent. The manager was non compliant when I asked to see where it states this was a company policy even though not against CA laws.

So I still come here every so often, but twice in the past month my office has ordered take out and I have been very impressed! I love how they package and label all the to go orders and so far every thing ordered has been perfect! The service inside is still kind of spotty sometimes, but they added those little tablets to each table so you can pay your bill with that instead of with your server (the tablet still splits checks, etc.) and even order additional items.  The bottomless fries and red robin seasoning is what keeps me coming back! Also, the royalty rewards is worth signing up for - free burger during your birthday month and every 10th item is free!
Although the staff here seemed unwilling to work around our tight schedule our food was promptly served to us and it tasted as good as expected. I would come back.
The food was plentiful and delicious.  The drinks  were reasonably priced and quite strong.  Casie,  our server was fun,  energetic  and very helpful.  We will definitely be back!
I love that the garden salads come with free refills. The food takes a long time. The idea of a side of broccoli that has free refills is amazing but it takes forever to receive it.

Dont get me wrong. I love red robin and so do my kids. But.... this review is based on our service.  Or the lack there of actually.  We walked in, got seated. And............ that's about it. We got our menus ,yes. But no one seemed to return. ever.  30 minutes went by.  Nothing.  So we started flagging people down and each one said they would get our waiter/waitress. And nothing.  45 minutes went by..... nothing.   So we just walked out and got STARES by all the employees as if we had the problem.  Yes we got a problem... weve been sitting right there for close to a freaking hour without anything as little as even drinks. And we flagged down like 4 people. So you know we were there.

This is based on my visits (yes, visits) from last week.  We have a bar that is being remodeled down the street so this place is real close.   For value, I would give this place 4.5 stars.  I get the $6.99 Red's Tavern Double with unlimited fries or unlimited side salad.  $6.99 for a burger bigger than a Big Mac (and tastier) and unlimited fries or side salad at a sit down restaurant is a great value.  I love the simplicity of their Red's Tavern Double compared to their larger gourmet burgers.  I guess I'm going back to the basics.  Their fries are good and unlimited.  Their side salad is a nice change from their fries.  I did notice that the lettuce at this location doesn't seem as fresh as the ones at their Costa Mesa location.  I sat at the bar and used the terminal to pay my bill.  I was in and out in what appeared to be the same amount of time to get a burger in the drive thru at In n Out.  I love their rewards program too.  One of the best in my opinion and definitely worth enrolling in, especially since it is free.  Every 10th burger is free and a free birthday burger.  Also, from time to time, they offer a free movie ticket with purchase of a $25 gift card.  I received a free movie ticket to the X-men movie.  That is like getting $35 for $25.

It took 50 min to get my regular burger out. The waitress didn't come by one time to apologize for the wait or to offer a refill that I was practically waiving at her. 2 couples came about 20 min after I did and got their food way before I did.  Worse customer service ever.

I've been to this location with my boyfriend at least three times in the past six months and haven't had a single bad experience. I prefer this location because it never gets as crowded as Tustin or the one in Santa Ana.  The Black and Bleu burger was pretty amazing. I'm a huge fan of jalapeños and tonight had the jala-rita-pina drink. The drink was delicious!  Foothill Ranch Towne Center offers a lot of different dining options. Red Robin is not a bad choice at all to have a casual lunch or dinner with friends. My boyfriend and I usually pick this place after seeing a movie at the nearby Regal (if we are in the mood for a burger). They have self serve pay kiosks at each table too!

I've been eating at Red Robin for almost 20 years and I must say I'm very disappointed with their new business model. They've recently completely remodeled their interior decor and have also rebranded their well known logo. But behind the scene, they've also made significant changes in their portions and prices. Prices have gone up and portion sizes have gone DOWN. The value seems to be diminished. You have to remember, this is a restaurant that makes burgers and fries. This is cheap food that should not cost so much. A family of 4 will spend a minimum of $50-$60 for not much food and it will make you feel silly for spending all that money for burgers and fries. The only reason I didn't give 1 star is because the servers are doing their best to keep people coming back. Ultimately, I will not be bringing my family back. The value is just not there anymore.

I Love this Foothill Ranch location of Red Robin Burger...one of the very Friendliest most Attentive Service even this evening when they were very busy the service was very Efficient Timely, Friend  & Organized and the Food was Very Fresh..my husband & I come to this location at least 3 - 5 times per month and have always experienced only the Best..which is really saying alot as we are very picky diners an  are from the old school of customer service , and this is definitely always the most perfect of customer service as it used to be .and should be..Quality Friendliness Freshest Food & Huge Portions at not a fancy price very Modestly Priced and Budget Friendly,  in a very clean and fun atmosphere, Thank You Red Robin Foothill Ranch

Just had a horrible experience with the hostess at Red Robin. We frequent this RR location, but we'll likely now choose Islands from now on. We, a party of 3, walked in at 8:30, and we were told we'd need to wait 10-15min. We're patient folks, but we noticed that the restaurant was only about 1/3 full. Not even kidding. There were several tables open, of all sizes and shapes. So, when I asked the hostess why we're not being seated, she shrugged, and said "People have been waiting patiently all night."  Again, not kidding. Wish I was. So, here we are at Islands, enjoying courteous service. Sorry Red Robin, just can't do it.

I hadn't been to a Red Robin for several years when I went with my family for lunch yesterday before a movie at the Regal cinema in the immediate area.  The menu has improved significantly since I've been away.  Expecting very limited options for my picky diet, I was delighted to find the offerings very flexible for different tastes and to allow for the adherence to various diets.  For example, they now have a Garden Burger and you can request this option with any of their burgers.  If you prefer a vegan diet, they also have a Boca Burger with which you can do the same with.  This is really big for vegetarians and vegans!  I was feeling like a salad and asked the waiter if I could exchange avocado for the chicken that comes on the Bansai Chicken salad and he couldn't have been more accommodating about the request.  He seemed delighted to be able to do that for me.  And, Red Robin has individually  priced these ingredients so that it actually cost me less to have this exchange (price of chicken, which I think was $2 was deducted and cost of avocado, $1.39 added).  Virtually no place else does this!  I love it!   My son had a Boca burger, and mom and hubby both chose the fish and chips, which came with four generous pieces of perfectly cooked cod.  Red Robin also offers various sides, so even though this dish has "chips" right in the name, mom was able to select a green salad instead.  The fries are steak fries and bottomless, so if you love great fries, this is the place to come.  Check the last page of the menu for healthier options, if that is of interest to you. Being that this was a Saturday afternoon, there were a lot of families dining so it was a bit noisy and it seemed to be taking a while to get the kid-trashed tables cleaned up after the parties had left, but we did get there at the end of their lunch rush, so this may not be typical. Very friendly service by our waiter, Nick, who stayed on top of drink refills and checked back several times to see if we needed anything.   And when you're ready to pay, no waiting for the bill - there is a device right at your table that will display your bill and permit you to pay electronically.  For cash payment, you'll need to enlist the assistance of your wait person.

Not sure how you can mess up fried sea food, but they did tonight. Got the seafood platter or whatever it is, and everything came out over fried. The runner was gone before I realized it and we had 3 different waiters, so I just gave up and ate it as it was. Normally it's not this bad, but RR gets worse every time I come here - I'm not a huge fan to begin with.  It was also pretty expensive, $30 for fried seafood, a salad and a soda. I knew there was another reason I never eat here.  Aside from the food being not so great, we had 3 servers on our table and certain items never came out when requested. Not sure why we didn't have just one waiter, but it would've made life a lot easier.  I'll keep patronizing Islands or Chilis for my Foothill Ranch restaurant options.

Saturday night dinner. Food was good, but it seemed really noisy. Couldn't hear the person across from me. Waitress was fast and friendly. I'd rate it 4 stars for food, but 2 stars due to the noise. Average that to 3 stars. I like the Whiskey River BBQ chicken wrap.
Patricia and Todd were great!!! Thanks for making our experience experience memorable!!! Todd thank you for taking care of me and my son right away we really appreciate it!

It's nice to see that they've been re-designing the interior and small touches on the outside. The menu is comprehensive, but not in the same way like Cheesecake factory where you feel like it's a phone book.  I ordered a blue cheese burger, but had them sub out for jalapeno coins instead of lettuce Tangy-Cool-Spicy all at the same time.  I wonder this though, they have these little kiosks on the table for games and food. You almost don't need waiters. I don't like them, they clutter things. And what's the point, you have a smart phone that does more, and there's still a waiter. One of these things has to go. Tip: Be careful when you go, they like to close up a tad early.

They've remodeled. Also, the evening servers  and staff are much friendlier than afternoon, in my opinion. Julie is who my group had tonight and she was great! It was a hectic night and I could tell she was super busy with lots of tables, but kept a smile on her face through it all and was as attentive as she could be. Only reason I knocked off a star is because we had some requests that were missed (such as no onions on my burger... I have a sensitivity, so I always check to be sure, but that could be bad for someone who doesn't check first and really can't have them due to an allergy or whatnot.) That's the restaurant's fault though, I feel, due to understaffing, not our server's fault.

I would imagine McDonald's is better than this place. I thought it would be a special treat for the family last Saturday so they chose Red Robin in foothill ranch. Server came and asked if we wanted drinks and if we were ready to order within the first minute if sitting down. He came back 3 more times within 3 minutes to ask same thing.  Then we never saw him again until we asked for him cuz the only one that didn't get her food was the 2 year old! The mac n chz didn't come in a bag but it was hotter than heck and had to wait another 5 min to cool. Shall I start on the frozen patty burgers? I better not.  I mean at least put some fresh lettuce and tomatoe, not the brown stuff.  The undercooked fries-who want bottomless of that!! Never, ever again!

Took the family there last night, was really looking forward to a fresh hot burger (of the past) but was unpleasantly surprised again. It wasn't terrible, & the service was fine but it took about 20 minutes for our food to come out & it just wasn't that great. Semi-warm, semi fresh sandwiches, fries, the kids pasta sucked my daughter refused to eat it or the stale brocoli, my wife's chicken sandwich was fatty.. It's been continually so disappointing the last few times at this location, and I wish I could say otherwise. Sorry Red Robin, there was a time we loved coming here but.. This last visit made it official.

We chose Red Robin in Foothill Ranch for my son's 7th B-day dinner because of the company's reputation for being a fun, family-friendly restaurant. We have been to several Red Robin's and we have had a great experience in the past. I do not recommend eating at this location. The food is good. However, this location has the worst customer service I have seen in years!  Our server took a really long time to greet us and take our order. She then kept us waiting over 40 minutes for our food without checking in to give us an update. When she did bring our food our kids meals were missing their sides and it took us over 15 minutes to get them after asking 2 different servers for help. We also asked for an order of fries and it arrived after our dessert, among a few other minor order mistakes. When my son's B-day dessert arrived it was dropped off quickly by another busy server and she did not wish him a happy b-day. I Had to tell her it was my son's B-day dessert. After we were halfway done with the dessert she brought the other servers over to sing which was nice but a little awkward as it was late.  We had to ask for our check and the whole experience was not at all what I had planned for a fun family celebration. I completely understand that restaurants get busy and kitchens get backed up. All I ask is for good customer service, a server that checks in with updates and I would have really appreciated a manager apology for our poor experience.

We went to this red robin for my sons birthday and i have to say we got the best service ive gotten in along time at any restaurant.  The server was awesome and the food was great. We never had to ask for refills and right before we left, the server have my son and i a to go drink. This place is a must go to

I just left the Foothill Ranch Red Robin. I have lived in Trabuco cyn for twelve years and have gone to this location many times over the years. Tonight after a long day at work my husband and went to grab dinner. We ordered at 645 and at 730 they brought us Cold food with no apology the MANAGER just put the burgers down and left. So we were done at this point. My husband talked to the manager who again offered no  Apology but instead sent the waiter out so we could pay for our drinks and left.  Being a manager of a major corporation you never send someone other than yourself to resolve a customers concern.  I know Red Robin won't care but you should save your time and money.

If I could give this place no stars I would . The only thing here that  was good was the Diet Coke with  lemon  I drank. The food was horrible , I ordered the fish and chips, it was so dry and the fries were  cold!!!! Please stay away, id rather eat frozen pizza from Albertsons!!!!
Omg I love this red robin!! It is Soooo good! Great service, great management and good waiters. I always choose this location and the food is bo-omb! I recommend the whiskey river bbq burger!!

I've been here before, it's newly remodeled, looks nice but things have changed.  I ordered a salad, I know, ordering a salad at a burger place ... but they should have options, right?  NOPE!  It was basically the END of a bag of salad.  Mostly cabbage, carrot slivers and mini lettuce.  I ordered an entree, not a side salad.  It was small, and not much to it.  If you're going to serve bag 'o salad, I won't return.  Sorry, won't be back.

Lots of food choices which kind of overwhelms me but in reality it's good to suit the pallet of everyone. Best known for burgers of all varieties and bottomless steak fries but of course I had no one to share with so I asked our server and she told me it was easier to tell me what was not good rather than what was good. I got a chicken salad to be safe. Meh, I'm not a huge fan of the token American diner type thing - and even if I was I've experienced better.

Went to lunch on a Wednesday with some coworkers. Waited an hour to get our food. They brought us free fries after 30 minutes but it still took 30 minutes took 3 burgers. Get real I could have driven to the store gone home made them and back to work in less time. Poor service all the way around. Don't bother going.

Ordered salads that were so bad. The serving size was much smaller than the salad served in the restaurant and they were lacking in toppings. It was as though they skimped on everything. In addition, the lettuce had the taste of that disgusting salad mix that you buy in a bag at the grocery store. I was very disappointed and will never order take out from this place again.

We were at Red Robin in Foothill Ranch, the service and food were great as usual. My wife got a free burger , fries and sundae for her BIRTHDAY!. My favorite burger is the Black and Bleu..Carissa was our server and she made it that much better. Thanks for the crew and the singing at our table..We will return as always

There is absolutely nothing gourmet about the burgers at Red Robin, same goes for the rest of the food here. Bottomless fries sounds great until you wait 15 minutes for a handful of fries, by that time you are done eating, not even worth asking for a third round. The burgers are poor quality, their veggie burger not made in house, boo. Kids meal was thrown together and really lacking in care here in general. Very much your average chain restaurant and it gets really noisy here as well. Not worth returning.

I don't know what's going on at this location. I call three times to place an order and they have me on hold for 5 minutes each call. Finally just put my order online and when I arrive they gave away my order. I can understand that Friday nights can be busy but this is not how you handle a business. The employees here are ridiculous.

I've been coming here for years off and on.  Usually my lapses were due to very slow service.  Recently my experience has been good.  Reasonably prompt and attentive service, and food served hot.  The food I've had (burgers, seafood scatter) has been good for this type of restaurant.  Really probably 3.5 but a extra half point for improvement in my visits.
great customer service when ordering to go food- burger was tasty and fresh , fries might need a little bit more seasoning. Thank you for supporting all Veterans.
They get 2 star because the service was good. Worst chili fries I ever had and the milk shake tastes like powder.

I had Donna as a server for my birthday last night and she gave me the best service I've had in a very long time! She made sure our drinks were filled and our basket of fries was never empty. The burgers we ordered were delicious. I will definitely be requesting Donna next time I go to Red Robin.

Host sat us at a "clean" table and the floor was filthy! After he left, we moved over to the next table because it wasn't AS dirty as the one he sat us at.  To be honest with you- the whole section's floor was filthy. I don't understand why they can't sweep after they wipe off the tables but I over heard the host while seating another group said "this is the toddler area" after the gentlemen made a comment about how dirty the floor was and suggest that his family sit at another table with a foodless floor around them. Their protocol is unacceptable. Why do I have to sit in someone else's filth because I had a toddler with me.  It literally takes 2 minutes to sweep up another persons mess! I would hate to see what the restrooms looked like if you think it's okay for me to eat like this.  Benny (server) was nice although we had to ask him multiple times for things we asked for when we ordered.  He eventually brought it out to us but it was a bit annoying trying to track him down.  Whiskey river BBQ was one of the RR favorites.  Asked for if medium and it came out more like well done.  Pretty bland because had a bite without BBQ sauce and a part that did. Of course the bite w/ BBQ was better but needless to say- salt was not in their vocabulary.   Would I come again- nope, gonna pass next time.

The hostess sat us at the worst table. My buddy ordered Mac and cheese, I finished my meal before he even got his. I ordered the French dip & it was good. We asked for more French fries but it took them nine minutes to bring more. Servers name is Jenny.

Sooooo, sitting here on a Wednesday night, the restaurant is half empty, the bar is almost empty and the hostess tells us it's a 30 minute wait, even for the bar. She tells us the bar staff needs to"catch their breath" so we can't sit in there, and the couple waiting next to us was told they were understaffed. I think the problem is bad management and scheduling, not the wait staff that showed up to do their jobs. Don't lay blame on the little guy, management needs to take responsibility. All I saw was money walking out the door. What a shame.

Been coming here for years and normally they are pretty good. Unfortunately management doesn't care about the customer even when it's Red Robin's fault. When you order a to go order over the phone it apparently sends you to a call service. We waited 30 minutes and then walked in to pick up the order. The call service never sent my order to the location so nothing was there. All they said was that they could try and rush it. Manager didn't want to comp anything and didn't care at all that Red Robin screwed everything up. Real unfortunate that they treat their customers like this but we see that it's now all about the money. Even when it comes to a customer that been going to this location a few times a month since it opened.

Best fries and ranch. That's my favorite part about Red Robin ! Fun experience and always loved up to my expectations. Pretty friendly staff and nice selection of food to choose from. I really enjoy the rewards program too. It's easy to earn a free burger, and they make it easy to get discounts and such.
We had excellent service and the food was great, no complaints and our waitress Jenny was awesome

Staff very friendly and courteous.  1 star is for incompetent kitchen staff and management.  My son has a gluten allergy which Red Robin is usually great with.  Tell server about the gluten allergy for my son and order a red tavern double burger with gf bun.  Food comes out and I asked person dropping off the food that are they sure his bun is gf because normally bun is darker in color.  She says yes.  So my son starts eating his burger and as he is eating luckily the server sees the bun and realizes the mistake.  Unfortunately he already ate the bun and I have to rush out of there and now home having to nurse my son with horrible stomachache.  Very pissed off at management for not making their staff aware of allergies that their patrons might have. To make matters worse once I get home realize that although charges for double burger only given a single burger.  Avoid this place if you have any allergies.

Took one of my mates for lunch expecting it to be as bad as Islands. Wrong! The service was phenomenal, quick to seat and serve bottomless fries and make drink and entree recommendations courtesy of miss Casie. Perfect place to eat before a movie.

Service was very fast and friendly. Waiter came by and gave fast refills and made sure everything's okay. Prices are worth it because the burgers are delicious and they come with bottomless fries. Lost a star through because my burger was pink but it was my fault I should of said "well done"
This place is sad. I never go here I mean like never. The one time I do I call in and of course nobody will pick up. Well onto islands. Thanks for nothing Red Robin and I mean literally nothing.

We've stopped by Red Robin since we lived in Seattle, where the chain was founded. Their hamburgers have always been excellent, kind of expensive but worth it. This visit we found little computer thingies on the tables. You could place your orders from these, play some games (extra $), and pay the bill. Obviously Red Robin is looking to reduce staff. I found the computer ordering process ungainly and not very intuitive, so we ordered from our server the usual way. That worked fine. A change: The milkshakes and malts, which used to come only in one size, now can be had two ways. The first or "classic" is a single fluted glass filled with the drink, whipped cream on top. The second or "monster" is the way they were always served before, the same fluted glass but a lot more in the metal container right from the milkshake mixer. Only a dollar more but too much for me; I had a classic malt. It was good, as usual, and enough. For burgers, I had a Gourmet Cheeseburger, an old standby and as good as ever. I wish they still wrapped them in paper, though, because otherwise they tend to disintegrate about two-thirds of the way through. My wife had the "keep it simple" burger, which she said was quite good. She also had a margarita which she gave excellent marks. The fries, included, were cut flat and a bit thin, somewhat chewy and not entirely to my taste. I think this is a change. My wife paid the bill using the computer thingy and that part was simple and went well. We got there about 11:30 and parking was close and easy. We were seated immediately and the service was fine. The food hasn't changed much, and that's fine also. Four stars, dinged a bit for the flaky computer ordering system and a couple of changes in the way things are prepared and served that I'm not so enthusiastic about. But we'll be back.

This is the Red Robin located in the Foothill Ranch Towne Center. Came in for a quick bite and sat in the bar area where usually you don't have to wait for a table. I was looking at the seasonal burgers and decided to order the Billion Dollar Baby. It had a potato cake, bacon, cheese, arugula and a nice patty of angus beef. I had substituted the bun for the onion bun and it came out delicious! The fries that came with it were stale but that's ok because it's bottomless fries so I told my server and she came out with a new one very fast! Service was good and so was the burger therefore based on my experience it was a 4 star.

We are regulars at this location.  I am leaving 4 stars as the service can be either really good or a little bit lackluster.  I have to say we had waitress Ellen and of all the wait staff she has by far been the best.  The booths/tables are sometimes not clean - last couple times there were crumbs or greasy fingers from whomever sat there before us.  It should be standard to wipe them off if they are dirty.  Overall the food is what is to be expected. Fries are delicious!  You can't go wrong with any of the burgers or milkshakes. I love the clucks as well.

Been coming here for years but today if all days I did not bring my ID and was carded (which they have never done before I'm 55 yrs old ...) by waitress and they could not sell me beer !!! Waitress did share they were expecting a "secret shopper" and was required to ask today! Oh well! I guess they are just doing their job! Water it is :-(

Horrible experience at this location, my girlfriend  and I came in for dinner and drinks, we each ordered a beer, they refused to serve my girlfriend  because she did not bring her I'd  (I'm 57 and she is 55 years old) I asked for the manager and he gave me some lame excuse that in California they are not allowed to serve you if they card you and you do not have an ID...bunch of bull... I have been at this place many times before and has never been a problem nor have I ever been carded... the manager had this cocky attitude which made our experience even worse. Based on all the other horrible reviews of this location, the manager does not care and apparently neither does corporate  because  they have done nothing to fix the situation.

We came here as a post birthday movie dessert and snack place.  What it came down to was, for as much as we payed, it was really not worth it.  My mom's chocolate cake was hot on the bottom, frozen in the middle.  My cheese cake was still frozen.  The chocolate covered brownie sticks were just not very good, or good quality for that matter.  My coffee mug had lipstick on it. I wasn't wearing lipstick.  I asked for a new cup of coffee, and politely waited. And waited. And waited. Didn't receive it until about 10 minutes before we left.  My father in law thought he had ordered the jumbo shake, and asked if he could get that instead, once he realized they had given him the regular size. It took a good 20 minutes before that came out.   Our server was very kind, and apologetic, but just over all, that was not a very good experience.

I have to say as far as chains so, I am a fan of Red Robin.  They also offer a free birthday meal if you sign up on their reward and they give you a birthday sundae which is nice.  I've celebrated quite a few birthdays for my niece & nephews here.  This location is convienent.  Plenty of parking in the parking lot.   Sometimes there's a line and sometimes there's not.  It's a hit or miss.  I do enjoy their burgers as well as their salads.  I love the sweet potatoe fries and they have bottomless fries which is nice.  On this visit they offered us some fries as appetizers while we waited for our burgers.  I usually like to try their special burgers but the price has been going up lately.  I wanted to try the salmon burger but it was 14.95 which is a lot especially since I want to add sweet potatoe fries which is an extra 1.99 or something like that.   Service was good, waitress was friendly but this also depends on when you go and how busy they are.  Overall, I do enjoy going.  :)

Now that was an American diner! Just the experience I wanted to have with my lady's  (when no one is looking of course). Took home my dinner to be later on that day. Very tasty! Very kind service! The very best!

I haven't been here in several years and recently went for lunch.  I was greeted and seated promptly and the waiter took my drink order and asked if I would like an appetizer. Great service. Unfortunately the food just didn't seem to match the service. The menu is amazing. They offer tons of choices and I think anyone could find something they wanted on that menu. They accommodate all diet types, gluten free, vegetarian, low fat, etc, and you can even customize your burger to a chicken or veggie option as well as the sides. Plus, they give you the nutritional break down on everything which is helpful to me. However, my meal just wasn't what I remembered from the past. I remember juicy, flavorful food and great fries.  I ordered the fiery chicken sandwhich and made a bun substitution to save calories. The sandwhich was described to have jalapeño coins (deep fried jalapeños which sound amazing!) a sauce, pepper jack cheese, lettuce, and tomato and of course, grilled chicken. The chicken was really rubbery and just lacked flavor. The much anticipated jalapeño coins were kind of disappointing, just seemed a little bland and not really spicy at all. I ate the entire sandwhich, and it was not bad by any means, but I just couldn't get excited about it. The fries were also just very mediocre.  Again not awful, but I couldn't get excited about them.  So I think I will try it again and maybe order a real burger and see how it goes. Overall if you want a meal that isn't gross but doesn't wow you, this meal will do it for you. The service was really great though and you can use the online checkout kiosk right on the table when time is of the essence.

First time dining here aND had a great experience! The service was wonderful everyone was super friendly and had valueble recommendations. We ordered our food and drinks and it all arrived in a timely fashion. Definitely recommend this spot for lunch!

There was a confusion in my order, but they took care of it. No question asked kiersten was AMAZING She was so professional and friendly She gave me something extra as a makeup for the mistake in my order This is the kind of customer service i hadn't seen in a long time Thank you Red Robin and Specially Kiresten I will defiantly come back again

There are very few times when my family gets the opportunity to eat at a restaurant, but recently we have been going to Red Robin. The food is great for the price and the servers are very friendly. There are iPads at each of the tables which are fun for families to play trivia on, but can be distracting from family conversation. Although I have only been here twice, the two servers that I have had the pleasure of meeting have been very nice and know the menu well. Benny is very patient and was able to answer all questions about the menu without hesitation. Kaitlyn was really nice and made sure all of our food got to us on time. Overall I would definitely recommend coming here.

Horrible service, took my family out to dinner before heading to the movies!! Well the girl who brought out of fries "NO JOKE" threw them on the table and fries fell on to the table!!! I was so upset I didn't finish my food by the time I got to talk to the manager I had already paid and just wanted to leave.. I told the manager what happen and all I got was "I'm sorry, I will talk to her" really!!! That's all your going to say to ME YOUR CUSTOMER!!!!! I left and told my husband and kids never again!! We love RR and go for every birthday or family outing, I guess we need to find another place to go! Not to mention they were having issues with a few of their beer taps (which I understand, it happens) but out of all the RR we go too, I wouldn't never recommend/nor return to this one in Foothill Ranch.. So disappointed!!!!!!

This particular Red Robin is located in Foothill Ranch. It is across from the 99 Cents Store. We placed a to-go order in, but based on the behavior of the staff here they did not start working on it until we got there to pick it up because it was much later than the estimated time of completion and took about the same amount of time as the estimate. They offered the standard amount of courtesy for the order being processed at this speed. (If I wanted work to begin on my food when I got there, I would have gone to Jack in the Box.) Either way the food was good and fresh, but I had to sustain myself on Razz Berries from the PokéStop until it was done.

Thank you so much to the manager at this specific location!!! He is wonderful!!  I ordered dinner online and I was having complications throughout the process (on my end) and when I went to check out I didn't realize you needed a card to pay for it (some places you pay when you get there) so I went to the bank and deposited the money and went to order, I realized the time had said 11:15am for pickup and I frantically went to change it before the order could process. I saw 8:45pm and chose that thinking that was when they take their last online order. When I got to Red Robin I checked in with the very sweet hostess if the order had went through because it didn't with the bank, and she said they didn't receive it. She immediately went to explain to her manager what happened, brought us out some fries and said he would be right with us! As I was talking to her I realized I had placed it for the next night! (Thankfully she realized before me) the manager came out and let me explain what happened, and after trying to call (somewhere) and they didn't answer to confirm the order he said he would make us the meals and we could be charged the next day. We also didn't realize we had ordered everything small, so he said he would do the bigger size for us this time! Everything was made so quickly and I felt bad because it was almost closing time and they had people coming in to eat, and dealing with us! When he brought out our food he even gave us extra fries in our bag for the wait. (Was no wait, really! But it was incredibly kind!) THANK YOU TO EVERYONE WHO HELPED US!! Wonderful staff!!!!!!

Delicious burgers, shakes, and yummy fries! Favorite burger is Fiery Ghost Tavern with Garlic Fries! AlWays get it with a Cookie Monster shake! Always more then friendly service here! Can't wait to come back!

Best service I've ever received at RR. I've always hated going to RR at the spectrum because you can never flag anyone down for more fries! My sister and I were starving after getting our nails done and she suggested RR. I reluctantly agreed, but so glad I did. We both got the tavern burger and it was soooo moist and juicy. It basically melted in our mouths and we didn't even realize we finished it!!! We had more than enough fries at any given time. We actually so much we had to bring a basket of them home! Definitely will be coming back!

I ate here with a girlfriend on Sunday July 16th. The only thing that both of our meals had in common was the ranch dressing. Both of us have had major stomach issues since Sunday (diarrhea and throwing up). I don't know if that was the cause, but too much of a coincidence otherwise. I won't be taking a chance here again. Yuck

Fun and family friendly restaurant with an excellent variety of menu options.  I love the bottomless garlic fries and am so glad that they are now made with "real" garlic!  They are so good that I often eat them as my main course. This is also a great place for birthday gatherings, happy hour and evening trips to have "unique" beverages with friends. Love this place!

I've been a fan of Red Robin for years, having been a customer back when they only had one restaurant near the University of Washington. I've been to many locations since then as they've expanded. Right when I was thinking Red Robin was becoming a tired relic I visited this location and was pleasantly surprised. It's like Red Robin sat on a tack and upped their game - this is definitely the best location I've been to. The menu has been revamped and the decor, while leaving much the same for the sake of nostalgia, has been modernized here and there. And an emphasis has been put on service which was exceptional. The customer uses a touchscreen on the table to rate their server at the end of the meal if they so desire; this feedback keeps them accountable as too many low scores can lead to termination. Despite a variety of new menu items I went with my reliable standby - Banzai Burger with fries and a chocolate milkshake.  Red Robin has always made an outstanding shake and I'm glad to report they still do. Thick and deliciously chocolatey it's one of the best out there. The burger was properly cooked to order (medium) and had great juicy flavor. The bun was fresh and soft plus it was the perfect size. The bottomless fries were great; the first bunch delivered were somewhat sparse but my server was quick to have them refilled. And he was right on the money in recommending their "campfire" dipping sauce for the fries. I loved it. It reminded me of Chick-fil-A sauce but with more of a smokey taste. Red Robin, what happened? Glad to see the improvements! Hope the other locations are doing as incredible a job as this one.
Terrible service. Had to walk out when manager brought over our cold food for the second time.

Went here with my parents for dinner when I came to visit this summer. It was really busy but we had a good waiter. My parents had fish and chips which they loved and I had a gluten free bun with a veggie burger--sooooo good.

Arrived and the waitress took forever then our food was wrong and the food was semi hot. Not going to come back to this location. Spare yourself and go to island. Also the waiters are over worked and the cooks don't listen to waiters. Also it took them 3 tries to make a burger and it was finally correct

I've been going to Red Robin for 40 years, having been born and raised in Seattle. Although I've visited numerous locations, Foothill Ranch stands out as my number one favorite. Of course, it must start at the top. We see the manager serving food, greeting customers and even cleaning the restroom. The food servers even rave about the management team. This must be why they are so happy, upbeat and go the extra mile to provide outstanding service.

I was very dissapointed in thier service and quality of food. The burgers were great however our fries were cold when they got to us. It took our server 20 mins or so to come back and check on us and by that point our food was already gone. He was not very kind when we requested refills on our drink and fries. He even forgot to bring one set of refill on fries. I will not return to this branch anytime soon. Certainly not the best way to keep regulars.
I haven't visited a Red Robin in years, this was much better than I remembered. Great burgers, very fresh food, our waitress was also wonderful!
The service is terrible here! It took forever just to get our drinks .. then we ordered and that took forever..and there are no waiters around! This place sucks.
It was so dirty!  The food was cold. It honestly I could not get over the splashed food on the wood shelves and dust all over them at eye level.  They need to clean! It was gross. :-(

My boyfriend used to take me to the original Red Robin in DT Seattle when the quality of the food was first class.  Unfortunately, the Foothill Ranch restaurant in 2017 offers average food in an average setting with slightly above average prices. The thrill is gone, sad to say.  I come here for the fish and chips, and in the past I have been pretty happy overall.  Tonight's meal was a mixed blessing: four small pieces of nicely battered cod in a sea of dry, lukewarm, uneven- sized French fries.  What has happened to RR's fries?!?  My order was obviously frozen--not "fresh" as boasted--and stiff as little surfboards.  Who would like "endless" quantities of these stale potatoes?   Next time I want a gourmet burger and hand-cut fries, I'll go to Burger Boss.  I can do without Red Robin's roomy booth when I'm looking for really tasty food.

Food was ok. Something different and is quick.  There is a good selection of food. The fries were cold when they came out but because of the bottomless fries we just got more. The service was good.  This is a good place to come with friends to grab something to eat and hang out.

I wish I could leave 0 stars!  We visited on 10/24 at 5:00 pm. Only one other table was full.  It took 10 minutes before anyone came to take a drink order. We ordered 1 Gourmet Burger, 1 Turkey Burger with Fries.  My wife's bun was so hard it must have been 3 days old.  Both sandwiches were lukewarm and our fries were cold.  A total disaster.  Hate to see it when this place is busy.  We left out terrible food and went next door to Islands-great burgers and everything nice and hot!
Came in after a long day of work, Todd was absolutely amazing! He was one of the best waiters I have ever had.  You rock Todd!!!

First of all let me let everyone know my family and I go here out of necessity most of all. If you would like the food prepared as you ask for it i.e some pink, medium.. well don't expect them to follow your request. Me and my son both were served black charred burgers. I asked for some pink and one half of the patty was black and I couldn't even eat it. I understand they have to cook kids burgers well, but black? C'mon management where is the quality control? When we complained to the server the manager didn't even come over to the table, it was obvious he had no control over what was happening on the floor w- servers or in the kitchen.  Don't go here, find something better.. and BTW a $13 burger is pretty easy to find elsewhere.

I went to the Red Robin on Towne Center Drive, in Foothill Ranch. I ordered the Bacon Cheeseburger combo, with: hardwood bacon, lettuce, tomatoes, mayo, and Swiss cheese. also with Steak Fries , and a Diet Coke, to balance the meal. Diana ordered, the Banzai combo; Teriyaki-glazed patty; topped with grilled pineapple, cheddar cheese, lettuce, tomatoes, and mayo. With steak fries, and a Diet Coke. For Dessert: I ordered; The Mountain High Mudd Pie, with: chocolate and vanilla ice cream, layered with Oreo Cookies, fudge and caramel; and topped with whipped cream, mmmm good!!!!! Great food and good service. note; the restroom was very clean, before I left it. :) Robert H.

Food was ok but OMG. Make sure you don't mind waiting 40 min for your food.  Their lame excuse, instead of owning it was that the black angus burger took longer.  Three different waiters acted like nothing happened so it must be a norm. #tipkill

Thank you RR for serving us even as we walked in 3 minutes until close. Thank you for putting up with our multiple orders of fries. Thank you to our waiter for going above and beyond and making us feel welcomed, even though we knew we were jerks for coming in so close to close.  Because of the fantastic service, we were able to get out in and out in about 30 min. Even more sweet was when we were chased after when leaving the restaurant from our waiter who was so gracious about the large tip we left.  The amount itself wasn't actually even that high, but we felt that they definitely earned the nearly 100% tip on our bill for putting up with us. You keep doing you RR!

Love coming here with our kids. Food is always good, but service is truly great. Every single server we have had always has impeccable customer service and goes above and beyond. Kuddos to management.
I was craving a Chicken salad and knew RR had exactly what I wanted! Crispy chicken salad with honey mustard dressing! Pomegranate tea! Hit the spot! Staff was Great!! RR Foothill Ranch

A booth in the bar section. Games on the tv --3 separate TVs   No neck alterations to view.  Staff are always on point. Don't hesitate on getting your red robin rewards card. I get emails on the best deals and I make a point to get in and get my 20% off.   I'm a big boy so I love a huge full meal. Robin completes me.   Start off with warmed up spinach artichoke  Blue ribbon double patty.   Always go the extra mile  Two chicken breast with steamed veggies
